metadata.Title: CVE-2010-3353 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Cowbell 0.2.7.1 places a zero-length directory name in the LD_LIBRARY_PATH,which allows local users to gain privileges via a Trojan horse sharedlibrary in the current working directory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2010-3353` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cowbell - 0.2.7.1-7
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: cowbell package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.2.7.1-7').
